alert.note: Alert for Grady; McClain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 19 at 6:23PM CDT until April 19 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Grady County in central Oklahoma... Northwestern McClain County in central Oklahoma... * Until 715 PM CDT. * At 623 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Chickasha, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Tuttle, Dibble, Cole, Amber, Bridge Creek, Middleberg, and Tabler. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area.
